access.title: Access control for roles accessing app environments

timezone.title: The timezone of the application
timezone.description:
This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run. It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified. 
See also: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/timezone.html

variables.title: Variables to control the environment
variables.description:
Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves. To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#variables

type.title: The base runtime (language) and version to use for this application
type.description:
The base image to use with a specific app language.  
Format: runtime:version. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#types

runtime.title: Runtime-specific configuration
runtime.description:
Customizations to your PHP or Lisp runtime. 
Contains a runtime dictionary: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#runtime

request_terminate_timeout.title: PHP timeout to terminate requests
request_terminate_timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for serving a single request after which the PHP-FPM worker process is killed.

sizing_hints.title: A sizing hints definition
sizing_hints.description:
The assumptions for setting the number of workers in your PHP-FPM runtime. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#sizing-hints

request_memory.title: The average memory consumed per request in MB

reserved_memory.title: The amount of memory reserved in MB

xdebug.title: An Xdebug definition
xdebug.description:
The setting to turn on Xdebug. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/languages/php/xdebug.html

quicklisp.title: Distributions for QuickLisp to use
quicklisp.deprecationMessage:
Lisp image no longer exists, please see 
https://devcenter.upsun.com/posts/deploying-with-lisp/ 
 for more information

enabled.title: Whether the preflight security blocks are enabled

ignored_rules.title: Specific rules to ignore during preflight security checks

dependencies.title: External global dependencies of this application
dependencies.description:
What global dependencies to install before the build `hook` is run. They will be downloaded by the language's package manager.  
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#dependencies

flavor.description: The pre-set build tasks to use for this application

build.title: The build configuration of the application
build.description:
It contains a build dictionary.  
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#build

root.title: The root of the application relative to the repository root
root.description:
Defaults to the root project directory.  
Useful for multi-app setups: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/multi-app.html

command.title: Operations that can be applied to the source code

operations.title: Operations that can be applied to the source code

source.title: Information on the appâ€™s source code and operations that can be run on it

web.title: How the web application is served

variables.title: Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves
variables.description: To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment.

timezone.title: The timezone of the application
timezone.description: This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run. It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified.

access.title: Access information, a mapping between access type and roles

root.title: The folder from which to serve static assets for this location relative to the application root
root.description:
The directory to serve static assets for this location relative to the appâ€™s root directory. Must be an actual directory inside the root directory. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#root-directory

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets
expires.description: How long static assets are cached. The default means no caching. Setting it to a value enables the `Cache-Control` and `Expires` headers. Times can be suffixed with `ms` = milliseconds, `s` = seconds, `m` = minutes, `h` = hours, `d` = days, `w` = weeks, `M` = months/30d, or `y` = years/365d. If a `Cache-Control` appears on the `headers` configuration, `expires`, if set, will be ignored. Thus, make sure to set the `Cache-Control`â€™s `max-age` value when specifying a the header.

passthru.title: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the app
passthru.description: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the application. On PHP, set to the PHP front controller script, as a URL fragment. Otherwise set to `true`/`false`.

scripts.title: Whether to allow scripts to run
scripts.description: Doesn't apply to paths specified in `passthru`. Meaningful only on PHP containers.

index.title: Files to look for to serve directories
index.description: Files to consider when serving a request for a directory. When set, requires access to the files through the `allow` or `rules` keys.

allow.title: Whether to allow serving files which donâ€™t match a rule

headers.title: A set of header fields set to the HTTP response
headers.description:
Any additional headers to apply to static assets, mapping header names to values. Responses from the app arenâ€™t affected. 
See how to set custom headers on static content: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/web/custom-headers.html

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets
expires.description: How long static assets are cached. The default means no caching. Setting it to a value enables the `Cache-Control` and `Expires` headers. Times can be suffixed with `ms` = milliseconds, `s` = seconds, `m` = minutes, `h` = hours, `d` = days, `w` = weeks, `M` = months/30d, or `y` = years/365d. If a `Cache-Control` appears on the `headers` configuration, `expires`, if set, will be ignored. Thus, make sure to set the `Cache-Control`â€™s `max-age` value when specifying a the header.

passthru.title: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the app
passthru.description: On PHP, set to the PHP front controller script, as a URL fragment. Otherwise set to `true`/`false`.

scripts.title: Whether to allow scripts to run
scripts.description: Doesn't apply to paths specified in `passthru`. Meaningful only on PHP containers.

allow.title: Whether to allow serving files which donâ€™t match a rule

headers.title: A set of header fields set to the HTTP response
headers.description:
Any additional headers to apply to static assets, mapping header names to values. Responses from the app arenâ€™t affected. 
See how to set custom headers on static content: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/web/custom-headers.html

rules.title: Specific overrides for specific locations
rules.description:
Contains a rules dictionary. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#rules

max_request_size.title: The maximum size request that can be buffered
max_request_size.description:
Supports K, M, and G suffixes. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#request-buffering

locations.title: The specification of the web locations served by this application

pre_start.title: Command run just prior to `start`
pre_start.description: Which can be useful when you need to run per-instance actions.

start.title: The command used to start the application
start.description:
It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP or FrankenPHP. 
See note: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#required-command

commands.title: The command to launch your app

socket_family.title: Whether your app listens on a Unix or TCP socket
socket_family.description:
If `tcp`, check the PORT environment variable on application startup. If `unix`, check SOCKET. 
More Information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#upstream

upstream.title: Configuration on how the web server communicates with the application

document_root.title: The document root of this application, relative to its root

passthru.title: The URL to use as a passthru if a file doesn't match the whitelist

index_files.title: Files to look for to serve directories

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets

move_to_root.title: Whether to move the whole root of the app to the document root

start.title: The command used to start the application
start.description: It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP.

role.title: which users can trigger it according to their user role

operations.title: Runtime operations that can be executed in the application container

build.title: Hook executed after the build process

deploy.title: Hook executed after the deployment of new code

post_deploy.title: Hook executed after an environment is fully deployed

hooks.title: What commands run at different stages in the `build`, `deploy` and `post_deploy` process

spec.title: The cron schedule specification
spec.description:
The cron specification. To prevent competition for resources that might hurt performance, use `H` in definitions to indicate an unspecified but invariant time. For example, instead of using `0 * * * *` to indicate the cron job runs at the start of every hour, you can use `H * * * *` to indicate it runs every hour, but not necessarily at the start. This prevents multiple cron jobs from trying to start at the same time. 
More information: 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron#Cron_expression

start.title: The command used to start the cron job
start.description:
By default, the command is run in Dash (till you specify something else): 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Almquist_shell

stop.title: The command used to stop the cron job
stop.description: The command thatâ€™s issued to give the cron command a chance to shutdown gracefully, such as to finish an active item in a list of tasks. Issued when a cron task is interrupted by a user through the CLI or Console. If not specified, a `SIGTERM` signal is sent to the process.

commands.title: A definition of what commands to run when starting and stopping the cron job

shutdown_timeout.title: The timeout in seconds after which the cron job will be forcefully killed
shutdown_timeout.description: When a cron is canceled, this represents the number of seconds after which a `SIGKILL` signal is sent to the process to force terminate it. The default is `10` seconds.

timeout.title: The cron timeout
timeout.description: The maximum amount of time a cron can run before itâ€™s terminated. Defaults to the maximum allowed value of `86400` seconds (24 hours).

crons.title: Scheduled cron tasks executed by this application

variables.title: Variables to control the environment
variables.description:
Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves. To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#variables

timezone.title: The timezone of the application
timezone.description:
This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run.  It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified. 
See also: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/timezone.html

source.title: The type of mount that will provide the data
source.description:
- By design, `storage` mounts can be shared between instances of the same app 
- `instance` mounts are local mounts 
- `tmp` (or `temporary`) mounts are local ephemeral mounts 
- `service` mounts can be useful if you want to explicitly define and use a Network Storage service

source_path.title: The path to be mounted
source_path.description:
Path relative to the root directory of the volume that's being mounted from.  
WARNING: Changing the name of your mount affects the source_path when itâ€™s undefined. See how to ensure continuity and maintain access to your files 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#ensure-continuity-when-changing-the-name-of-your-mount

service.title: The name of the service that the volume will be mounted from
service.description: Must be a service in `services.yaml` of type `network-storage`.

mounts.title: Filesystem mounts of this application
mounts.description:
Directories that are writable even after the app is built. Allocated disk for mounts is defined with a separate resource configuration call using `upsun resources:set`. 
Contains a dictionary of mounts: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#mounts

access.title: Access control for roles accessing app environments

pre_start.title: The command used to run before starting the application

start.title: The command used to start the application
start.description:
It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#workers

post_start.title: A command executed after the application is started

commands.title: The commands to manage the worker

workers.title: Alternate copies of the application to run as background processes

additional_hosts.title: Maps of hostnames to IP addresses

stack.title: Composable Image definition
stack.description:
A list of packages from the Upsun collection of supported runtimes and/or from NixPkgs.  
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/composable-image.html

routes.title: The routes of the project
routes.description:
Each route describes how an incoming URL is going to be processed by Upsun. 
More information:  
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html

services.title: The services of the project
services.description:
Each service listed will be deployed to power your Upsun project.  
More information:  
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html 
Full list of available services:  
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services

type.title: The service type
type.description:
One of the available services in the format `type:version`. 
More information:  
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services

configuration.title: The configuration of the service
configuration.description:
Some services have additional specific configuration options that can be defined here, such as specific endpoints. 
See the given service page for more details:  
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services.

container_profile.title: The container profile for this application/service in production
container_profile.description:
Leave blank to allow it to be set dynamically. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/manage-resources/adjust-resources.html#adjust-a-container-profile

primary.title: Whether the route is the primary route for the project
primary.description: If true, this route is the primary route of the environment

id.title: Route Identifier
id.description:
A unique identifier for the route. See route identifiers: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html#route-identifiers

attributes.title: Attributes of the route
attributes.description:
Arbitrary attributes attached to this resource: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html#route-attributes

redirects.title: The configuration of the redirects
redirects.description:
Defines redirects for partial routes. For definition and options, see the redirect rules: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html

expires.title: The duration the redirect is cached
expires.description:
Examples of valid values include 3600s, 1d, 2w, 3m. 
To disable caching for all your redirects, set expires to 0. You can also disable caching on a specific redirect:  
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#disable-caching-on-your-redirects

regexp.title: Whether the path is a regular expression
regexp.description:
Specifies whether the path key should be interpreted as a PCRE regular expression. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#partial-redirects

to.title: The URL to redirect to
to.description:
A relative URL - '/destination',  
or absolute URL - 'https://example.com/'. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#partial-redirects

prefix.title: Prefix of the redirect path
prefix.description:
Specifies whether both the path and all its children or just the path itself should be redirected.  
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#redirects-using-prefix-and-append_suffix

append_suffix.title: Suffix of the redirect path
append_suffix.description:
Determines if the suffix is carried over with the redirect. More information. 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#redirects-using-prefix-and-append_suffix

code.title: The redirect HTTP status code to use
code.description:
Valid status codes are 301, 302, 307, and 308.  
Defaults to 302 for Partial redirects: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#partial-redirects 
and 301 for Whole-route redirects: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#whole-route-redirects 
More information:  
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#specify-a-http-status-code

expires.title: The amount of time, in seconds, to cache the redirects
expires.description:
The duration the redirect is cached for.  
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#manage-caching

tls.title: TLS settings for the route
tls.description:
The absolute URL or other route to which the given route should be redirected with an HTTP 301 status code. 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/https.html#optional-configure-tls-connections

enabled.title: Whether strict transport security is enabled or not
enabled.description:
If set to true, HSTS is enabled for 1 year.  
If set to false, other properties are ignored.

include_subdomains.title: Whether the strict transport security policy should include all subdomains

preload.title: Whether the strict transport security policy should be preloaded in browsers
preload.description:
To add your website to the HSTS preload list: 
https://hstspreload.org/. 
Thanks to this list, most browsers are informed that your site requires HSTS before an HSTS header response is even issued.

min_version.title: The minimum TLS version to support.
min_version.description: Note that TLS versions older than 1.2 are deprecated and are rejected by default.

client_authentication.description: The type of client authentication to request.

client_certificate_authorities.title: Certificate authorities to validate the client certificate against
client_certificate_authorities.description:
If not specified, a default set of trusted CAs will be used. 
More Information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/https.html#enable-mtls

to.title: Redirect destination
to.description:
The absolute URL or other route to which the given route should be redirected with an HTTP 301 status code. 
A relative URL - '/destination', or absolute URL - 'https://example.com/' 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#partial-redirects

default_ttl.title: The TTL to apply when the response doesn't specify one. Only applies to static files

cookies.title: The cookies to take into account for the cache key

headers.title: The headers to take into account for the cache key

upstream.title: The upstream to use for this route
upstream.description:
The name of the app to be served (as defined in your app configuration) followed by :http. Example: app:http 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html#route-configuration-reference

relationships.title: The relationships of the application/service to other services

protocol.title: The IP protocol to apply the restriction on

ips.title: The IP range in CIDR notation to apply the restriction on
ips.description:
See a CIDR format converter: 
https://www.ipaddressguide.com/cidr 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#workers

domains.title: Domains of the restriction
domains.description:
Fully qualified domain names to specify specific destinations by hostname 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#workers

ports.title: The port to apply the restriction on
ports.description: Ports from 1 to 65535 that are allowed. If any ports are specified, all unspecified ports are blocked. If no ports are specified, all ports are allowed. Port 25, the SMTP port for sending email, is always blocked.

firewall.title: Outbound firewall rules for the application

source.title: The type of mount that will provide the data
source.description:
- By design, `storage` mounts can be shared between instances of the same app 
- `instance` mounts are local mounts 
- `tmp` (or `temporary`) mounts are local ephemeral mounts 
- `service` mounts can be useful if you want to explicitly define and use a Network Storage service

source_path.title: The path to be mounted, relative to the root directory of the volume that's being mounted from
source_path.description:
WARNING: Changing the name of your mount affects the source_path when itâ€™s undefined. See how to ensure continuity and maintain access to your files 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#ensure-continuity-when-changing-the-name-of-your-mount

service.title: The name of the service that the volume will be mounted from
service.description:
Must be a service in `services.yaml` of type `network-storage`. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#mounts

mounts.title: Filesystem mounts of this application
mounts.description:
Directories that are writable even after the app is built. Allocated disk for mounts is defined with a separate resource configuration call using `upsun resources:set`. 
Contains a dictionary of mounts: 
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#mounts

size.title: The container size for this application in production
size.description: Leave blank to allow it to be set dynamically.

base_memory.title: The base memory for the container

memory_ratio.title: The amount of memory to allocate per units of CPU
